author: Paul Rankin
method: Mix the cheese, chorizo, beans, coriander and salt and freshly ground black pepper in a bowl. Spread the mixture onto one of the tortillas and top with the other. Heat a little oil in a frying pan and pan-fry the quesadilla for 2-3 minutes on each side. Meanwhile, heat the olive oil in a pan and sauté the garlic for one minute. Stir in the tomato and heat for a few minutes. Blend until smooth. To serve, transfer the quesadilla to a plate and serve the tomato sauce alongside.
ingredients: 85g/3oz cheddar cheese, grated,  55g/2oz chorizo, diced,  85g/2oz mixed beans, diced,  handful fresh coriander, chopped,  salt and freshly ground black pepper ,  2 Mexican tortillas,  2 tbsp olive oil,  1 garlic clove, peeled and chopped,  150g/5¼oz tin tomatoes
